Letter from Henry Frowde, Hodder & Stoughton to Henry Rose Carter, January 10, 1922

div1.p: The firm of Henry Frowde, Hodder & Stoughton informs Carter about its pricing policies for reprints of medical journals.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Frowde, Hodder & Stoughton to Henry Rose Carter, January 10, 1922
div1.opener:

OXFORD MEDICAL PUBLICATIONS
OXFORD UNIVERSITY PRESS, SIR ERNEST HODDER-WILLIAMS, R PERCY HODDER-WILLIAMS, A CECIL STOUGHTON

HENRY FROWDE AND HODDER & STOUGHTON
THE LANCET BUILDING, 1 & 2 BEDFORD STREET
LONDON, W.C. 2
January 10, 1922.
Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
2121, California Street, N.W.,
Washington, D.C.,
U.S.A.
Dear Sir,
div1.p:
In reply to your letter of the 28th
ult., enclosing a money order for £1:16: 6,
for which we enclose our formal receipt, we
are returning our letter to you of September
together with other exhibits, and would point
out that the published price of Byam's
“Practice of Medicine in the Tropics” is £12:12:0
net, but that £9:9:0 was the subscription price
which was a special offer made to the profession
for orders received before the day of publication.
As pointed out in our offer to the contributors,
that owing to the great expense involved we were
unable to present complimentary copies, but
offered a set for half of the published price.

We trust this will clear any mis-
understanding.
div1.closer:
Yours faithfully, The Joint Committee of
HENRY FROWDE, HODDER & STOUGHTON.
